snippet: A throng of officers from Massachusetts and neighboring states rushed to a Boston suburb without any coordination with police commanders, the report said.
abstract: New report by Massachusetts State Police and government officials contends throng of 'self-deployed' officers from Massachusetts and neighboring states rushed to Boston suburb in wake of 2013 Boston Marathon bombings lacking any coordination with police commanders; says more than 2,500 officers converged on Watertown in dangerous and uncontrolled action.
lead_paragraph: A throng of officers from Massachusetts and neighboring states rushed to a Boston suburb without any coordination with police commanders, the report said.

headline.main: Report Details Flawed Law Enforcement Response to Marathon Bombings
headline.print_headline: New Report Details Flawed Law Enforcement Response After Marathon Bombings
